intro: Terpsichore steyermarkii, commonly known as the Steyermark's terpsichore, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the high elevations of the Appalachian Mountains in the eastern United States. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full shade. Terpsichore steyermarkii is often found in rocky outcrops and forested areas, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
